body: Can you add instructions for building and running your repro?

@perezd How do you make the repro use a Netty version that's built and installed into the local `~/.m2/` repository? I'm trying to make it use a local `4.1.53.Final-SNAPSHOT` version, but just changing the `NETTY_VERSION` constant in the `WORKSPACE` file is not enough.

This would work, if you add the jars to the BUILD file:
https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/java.html#java_import

Then just changes `deps` to point to that new target and it should work.

issue.title: Fix native image build on modern GraalVM versions for the cases when …

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
…the program uses netty-dns

Motivation:

Since GraalVM version 19.3.0, instances of java.net.InetAddress (and its subclasses Inet4Address and Inet6Address) are not allowed in native image heap (that is, they cannot be stored in static fields of classes initialized at build time or be reachable through static fields of such classes). When building a native image, it makes sense to initialize at build time as many classes as possible.
But some fields of some classes in Netty (for example, NetUtil.LOCALHOST4) contain InetAddress instances. If a program is using code path that makes it possible to reach such fields at build time initialization, it becomes impossible to build a native image initializing core Netty classes initialized at runtime. An example of such a program is a client that uses netty-dns.

Modifications:

- Update GraalVM version to the recent 20.2.0
- Add netty-testsuite-native-image-client Maven module to test that such an example program can be built after the corresponding fixes
- Add native-image.properties to resolver-dns module to move initialization of some classes to runtime (some of them are parsing configuration during initialization, so it makes no sense to initialize them at build time; for others, it's needed to avoid InetAddress reachability at build time)
- Add substitutions for NetUtil.LOCALHOST4, NetUtil.LOCALHOST6 and NetUtil.LOCALHOST to overcome the InetAddress-related prohibition
- Extract some initialization code from NetUtil to NetUtilInitializations to allow it to be used by the substitutions

Result:

A client program using netty-dns with --initialize-at-build-time=io.netty builds successfully

Links:

This grows from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63328298/how-do-you-debug-a-no-instances-of-are-allowed-in-the-image-heap-when-buil

These are the changes I made to the reproducer repo in order to get it sort-of building with custom jar files:

```patch
diff --git a/BUILD b/BUILD
index 1c8f0c3..c953f9b 100644
--- a/BUILD
+++ b/BUILD
@@ -5,10 +5,11 @@ java_library(
     name = "main",
     srcs = ["Main.java"],
     deps = [
-        "@maven//:io_netty_netty_codec_http",
-        "@maven//:io_netty_netty_transport",
-        "@maven//:io_netty_netty_transport_native_epoll_linux_x86_64",
-        "@maven//:io_netty_netty_handler",
+    	"//third_party:netty"
+        #"@maven//:io_netty_netty_codec_http",
+        #"@maven//:io_netty_netty_transport",
+        #"@maven//:io_netty_netty_transport_native_epoll_linux_x86_64",
+        #"@maven//:io_netty_netty_handler",
     ],
 )
 
diff --git a/WORKSPACE b/WORKSPACE
index 1beffb0..e0cb416 100644
--- a/WORKSPACE
+++ b/WORKSPACE
@@ -4,8 +4,8 @@ load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
 
 http_archive(
     name = "rules_graal",
-    sha256 = "c1445dd6263b17b110da69178c238dc0925bbea1bffc93c46f5af4f8027245cc",
-    strip_prefix = "rules_graal-master",
+    sha256 = "f5fc694e0abe24699987aab1c4054536c1792ed8a17123a9d7223511fac2367d",
+    strip_prefix = "rules_graal-1b5f6deef8352c4b64541bb0f699fd2af5ae6b0b",
     urls = [
         "https://github.com/andyscott/rules_graal/archive/1b5f6deef8352c4b64541bb0f699fd2af5ae6b0b.zip",
     ],
@@ -72,3 +72,4 @@ maven_install(
 load("@maven//:defs.bzl", "pinned_maven_install")
 
 pinned_maven_install()
+
diff --git a/third_party/BUILD b/third_party/BUILD
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..aa16a03
--- /dev/null
+++ b/third_party/BUILD
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+package(default_visibility = ["//visibility:public"])
+java_import(
+	name = "netty",
+	jars = [
+	    "netty/netty-common-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	    "netty/netty-buffer-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	    "netty/netty-codec-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	    "netty/netty-codec-http-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	    "netty/netty-transport-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	    "netty/netty-transport-native-unix-common-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	    "netty/netty-transport-native-epoll-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	    "netty/netty-handler-4.1.54.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar",
+	],
+)
```

issue.title: GraalVM native-image doesn't compile with Netty

labels.name: graal
labels.description: Issues related to running on GraalVM

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
### Expected behavior
Netty compiles with GraalVM native-image

### Actual behavior
Compilation fails:


### Steps to reproduce
Run
```
./gradlew clean :social-media-server:shadowJar && native-image -cp social-media-server/build/libs/social-media-server-all.jar 
```

### Minimal yet complete reproducer code (or URL to code)
Here is a gradle project to reproduce it:
[social-media.zip](https://github.com/netty/netty/files/6217669/social-media.zip)

### Netty version
`io.netty:netty-all:4.1.60.Final`

### JVM version (e.g. `java -version`)
```
java -version
openjdk version "11.0.10" 2021-01-19
OpenJDK Runtime Environment GraalVM CE 21.0.0.2 (build 11.0.10+8-jvmci-21.0-b06)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM GraalVM CE 21.0.0.2 (build 11.0.10+8-jvmci-21.0-b06, mixed mode, sharing)
```

### OS version (e.g. `uname -a`)
OSX
```
uname -a
Darwin Scott-Pierce 19.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 19.6.0: Tue Jan 12 22:13:05 PST 2021; root:xnu-6153.141.16~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64
```

body:
The Epoll transport is currently not supported in Graal because it loads classes from JNI code, and those classes needs to be initialised at runtime.

You can work around this by adding something like this to the `native-image` command:

```
--initialize-at-run-time=io.netty.handler.ssl.util.ThreadLocalInsecureRandom,io.netty.channel.unix,io.netty.channel.epoll,io.netty.channel.kqueue
```

issue.title: Initialise epoll at runtime in native images

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:
People expect Netty to just be Netty when building native images, and so try to use the epoll transport.

Modification:
Add a native-image.properties file that tells native-image to initialise all of the epoll classes at runtime.

Result:
We can now use epoll in native runtime images.

Fixes #11122 #10616 #9918

body: @perezd I tried making epoll work in Graal native-image in #11163, but it's running into issues I don't fully understand. If you have any ideas feel free to chime in.

Bit out if my depths here but wondering if it could have to do with JNI config? https://www.graalvm.org/reference-manual/native-image/JNI/

Does netty use reflection related to JNI? This could cause an issue potentially?
@chrisvest  So where does this stand now that https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/11163 has been closed?
